name: System administrator
description:
A system administrator can:
Control all aspects of the system: users, organizations, compute resources, general settings, etc.
This role has global system control and should be limited to a small group of skilled IT administrators.

name: Data volume administrator
description:
A Data volume administrator can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: datavolumes, datavolumes/sharedscopes
View: jobs, workspaces, dashboards, environments, compute resources, data sources, templates

name: L1 researcher
description:
An L1 researcher can do the following within their assigned projects: 
Create, view, edit, delete: jobs, workspaces, environments, data sources, compute resources, templates, datavolumes
View: dashboards

name: ML engineer
description:
An ML engineer can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, edit, view, delete: deployments
View: departments, projects, clusters, node-pools, nodes, dashboards, datavolumes

name: Viewer
description:
A viewer can:
View: departments, projects, respective subordinates (jobs, deployments, workspaces, environments, data sources, compute resources, templates), dashboards, datavolumes
A viewer cannot:
Edit: configurations

name: L2 researcher
description:
An L2 researcher can do the following within their assigned projects: 
Create, view, edit, delete: jobs, workspaces
An L2 researcher cannot do the following within their assigned projects:
Create, edit, delete: environments, data sources, compute resources, templates

name: Environment administrator
description:
An environment administrator can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: environments
View: jobs, workspaces, dashboards, data sources, compute resources, templates, datavolumes

name: Credentials administrator
description:
A credentials administrator can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: credentials
View: jobs, workspaces, dashboards, data sources, compute resources, templates, environments, datavolumes

name: Data source administrator
description:
A data source administrator can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: data sources
View: jobs, workspaces, dashboards, environments, compute resources, templates, datavolumes

name: Cloud support
description:
A cloud support can do the following:
View: all aspects of the system.

name: Editor
description:
An editor can do the following within their assigned scope:
View: screens, dashboards
Manage: departments, projects, datavolumes, datavolumes/sharedscopes

name: Research manager
description:
A research manager can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: environments, data sources, compute resources, templates, datavolumes, datavolumes/sharedscopes
View: projects, related jobs and workspaces, dashboards

name: Department viewer
description:
A department viewer can do the following within their assigned scope:
View: departments, projects, assigned subordinates (jobs, deployments, workspaces, environments, data sources, compute resources, templates), dashboards, datavolumes

name: Application administrator
description:
An application administrator can:
Manage: departments, projects.
Assign: roles (department administrator, researcher, ML engineer, research manager, viewer).
View: users, dashboards (including Consumption), nodepools.

name: Department administrator
description:
A department administrator can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: departments, projects, datavolumes, datavolumes/sharedscopes
Assign: roles (researcher, ML engineer, research manager, viewer) within those departments and projects
View: dashboards (including Consumption)

name: Cloud operator
description:
A cloud operator can do the following:
Manage: clusters, settings, nodepools.
View: nodes, users, roles, event history.

name: Compute resource administrator
description:
A compute resource administrator can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: compute resources
View: jobs, workspaces, dashboards, environments, data sources, templates, datavolumes

name: Template administrator
description:
A template administrator can do the following within their assigned scope:
Create, view, edit, delete: templates
View: jobs, workspaces, dashboards, environments, compute resources, data sources, datavolumes
